title: A Picturesque Estate on a UNESCO World Heritage Site in Saint Lucia
text:
The compound has views of the Caribbean Sea and Saint Lucia’s famous Pitons.

Text size

Listing of the Day

Location: Val des Pitons, Saint Lucia

Price: $4.5 million

Nestled in a valley along the Caribbean Sea, this Saint Lucia estate offers an idyllic island compound.

Dubbed the Beausejour Residence, the property is a part of the Beau Estate, located in Saint Lucia’s Val de Pitons, or Valley of the Pitons. The land is a part of a designated UNESCO World Heritage Site, guaranteeing protection against new development.

Notable Caribbean architect Lane Pettigrew designed and owns the residence. He added the compound’s villas, but the property’s church-like structure dates to the 18th century. The building formerly served as a copra house, which was used for coconut curing, said listing agent Marlene De Cespedes of Douglas Elliman.

All of the property’s structures are connected by pathways, but each villa is private.

More: Turnkey Oceanfront Villa in a Private Dominican Republic Resort

The property faces west, creating expansive views of the Caribbean Sea across the residence.

Ms. De Cespedes said her favorite facet of the estate is the open-wall dining bungalow that looks directly out over the sea. She said "the views are beautiful at anytime" but especially at sunset.

The property’s former copra house dates back to the 18th century. Douglas Elliman

Mr. Pettigrew also owns three neighboring vacant lots—totaling 3.63 acres—that are available for sale and already have design plans. The three lots are priced at $3.2 million.

"There’s so much room for expansion," Ms. De Cespedes said.

While Mr. Pettigrew raised his children there, the property is also suitable to serve as a boutique hotel or a space for events such as weddings.

More: Two-Bedroom St. Barts Villa With a Strong Rental History

Stats

The three-and-a-half-acre estate has four villas which in total provide six bedrooms and six bathrooms.

The estate has approximately 5,000 square feet of living space.

Amenities

A waterfall-style swimming pool is positioned steps below a smaller dining bungalow, overlooking the Caribbean Sea. There is also a covered patio off the pool.

The residence offers six bedrooms. Douglas Elliman

Neighborhood Notes

The beach is just a few minutes’ walk down the hill, and the nearest town is about 15 minutes away by car, Ms. De Cespedes said. Sugar Beach Resort is also a short walk away.

The property sits between the Pitons, two prominent volcanic plugs in the Caribbean Sea that add to the estate’s picturesque view.

"When you’re at the property, you feel like you could touch them," Ms. De Cespedes said.

The larger of the two, Gros Piton, attracts hikers for guided tours of the natural landmark.

Listing agent: Marlene De Cespedes, Douglas Elliman
